metadata.synopsis: Minsc and Jaheira are bickering in the camp ahead of their reunion scene - Intended as a holding pattern to draw the player's attention to them before a big happy reunion and lore moment.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Rescue Minsc from the Cistern- Go to camp- See them arguing

1.speaker: Jaheira
1.text: You can point that smug little smile somewhere else, for a start.
1.context: NodeContext: Still a little annoyed even though the argument is resolved, but cooling off

6.speaker: Minsc
6.text: Ah, forgive me, Jaheira. But it is just so good to be together again!

5.speaker: Jaheira
5.text: Do not get too comfortable just yet. I will want a full report - everything you learned during your time with the cult.
5.context: NodeContext: Giving up on her line of questioning Minsc, nows it's her fault for even trying.

0.speaker: Minsc
0.text: Of course, Jaheira! I think they have something to do with illithids.
0.context: NodeContext: Giving up on her line of questioning Minsc, nows it's her fault for even trying.

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.context: NodeContext: Giving up on her line of questioning Minsc, nows it's her fault for even trying.

10.speaker: Minsc
10.text: Jaheira... I am sorry that I was so easily blinded. There was more than the tadpole to the cult's manipulations of Minsc.

2.speaker: Jaheira
2.text: I know, old friend. They made a poor imitation at me, bossing you around.
2.context: InternalNodeContext: Just to build on Boo having seen Jaheira's basement - entirely meant to be a silly gag about Boo being one of Jaheira's contacts.

3.speaker: Minsc
3.text: Oh, no. I speak of how they sealed Boo away, so that he would not remind me of the man he has taught me to be.
3.context: NodeContext: Catching himself, realising he may have offended Jaheira.

4.speaker: Minsc
4.text: B-but - you, too, are important to Minsc!
4.context: NodeContext: Catching himself, realising he may have offended Jaheira.

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: Too late. But don't worry, I shall try to sob into a pillow tonight so as not to wake the entire city.
